section.p: The related-links section of DITA topics is a special structure that supports the navigational rules from a topic to its related neighbor topics, whether parent/child relationships (hierarchy), sibling relationships (browse sequences), types (collections), and whether the link is internal or external to the set.Related Links elements

Links are different from cross-references in that cross-references occur only within the body of a topic and can target any element in this or other topics; links only represent topic-to-topic connections.
